node.title: Police reveal top three tips to keep parcel deliveries safe this Christmas
node.description: Almost half a million Kiwis had a package stolen between February 2020 and February 2021.
node.content: ["Police have released a video with tips on how to keep your parcels safe this festive season.\u00a0", "With Christmas just ten days away, lots of Kiwis are ordering presents online and getting them delivered to their homes.\u00a0", "So far in 2021, there have been 79,101 recorded theft and related offences according to police statistics.\u00a0", "A survey completed by financial research and comparison website Finder found 13 percent of New Zealanders - almost half a million Kiwis - had a package stolen between February 2020 and February 2021.", "Constables Olivia Gregory and Renee Robertson from the prevention team have three simple, easy tips for New Zealanders to make sure they receive their parcels this Christmas.\u00a0", "The first tip Gregory and Robertson recommend is having your parcel delivered to a business or where someone can sign for it.\u00a0", "By doing this, you know that it's either going to a secure and trusted location or if you're not home, your delivery company will take it back to their branch, where it's safe and you can pick it up at your convenience.\u00a0", "The second tip they recommend is setting up a secure lockbox.", "\"I know someone who lives rural and they have a shared secure lockbox for all of the houses down the lane,\" Robertson said.", "By having a secure location for your parcels to be dropped off at, it will be out of sight and locked away from anyone looking to steal parcels this Christmas.\u00a0", "A secure lockbox is also handy in a COVID environment. Posties can drop off your presents in a contactless way.\u00a0", "Not many Kiwis know, but Countdown offers a parcel collection service. If you go online, you can see the area you live in and where you can get the parcels delivered to.\u00a0", "This is also a great way if you're wanting to get Christmas gifts delivered secretly to surprise a friend or family member. All you need to do is deliver your parcel under your name to a Countdown store offering the service, then collect it at a time that suits you so your surprise won\u2019t be ruined."]
